  3#ifndef VSIP_CORE_USER_STORAGE_HPP
  4#define VSIP_CORE_USER_STORAGE_HPP
  5
  6#include <vsip/core/storage.hpp>
  7
  8namespace vsip
  9{
 10
 11enum user_storage_type 
 12{
 13  no_user_format = 0,
 14  array_format,
 15  interleaved_format,
 16  split_format
 17};
 18
 19namespace impl
 20{
 21
 22/// If provided type is complex, extract the component type,
 23/// otherwise use the provided bogus type.
 24template <typename T, typename BogusT>
 25struct Complex_value_type
 26{
 27  typedef BogusT type; 
 28  typedef BogusT ptr_type;
 29};
 30
 31template <typename T, typename BogusT>
 32struct Complex_value_type<complex<T>, BogusT>
 33{
 34  typedef T  type; 
 35  typedef T *ptr_type;
 36};
 37
 38/// Class to hold storage that has been given to us by the user.
 39/// For complex data, this can be in three different formats (array
 40/// of complex, array of interleaved real, or arrays of split real).
 41/// The block value type does not determine/restrict which type of
 42/// data the block can be constructed with.
 43///
 44/// General case intended for non-complex types.
 45template <typename T>
 46class User_storage
 47{
 48public:
 49  User_storage() : format_(no_user_format), data_(0) {}
 50  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T* data)
 51    : format_(format), data_(data)
 52  { assert(format == array_format);}
 53
 54  /// This constructor is provided so that `User_storage<T>` and
 55  /// `User_storage<complex<T> >` can be interchanged, however it
 56  /// should not be called.
 57  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T* real, T* /*imag*/)
 58    : format_(format), data_(real)
 59  { assert(0);}
 60
 61  user_storage_type format() const { return format_;}
 62
 63  T    get(index_type i) { return this->data_[i];}
 64  void put(index_type i, T val) { this->data_[i] = val;}
 65
 66  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
 67  /// a Storage class.
 68  typename Storage<Cmplx_inter_fmt, T>::type as_storage(Cmplx_inter_fmt) const
 69  {
 70    assert(this->format_ == array_format);
 71    return this->data_;
 72  }
 73
 74  // For scalar types, there is no distinction between interleaved and
 75  // split.
 76  typename Storage<Cmplx_split_fmt, T>::type as_storage(Cmplx_split_fmt) const
 77  {
 78    assert(this->format_ == array_format);
 79    return this->data_;
 80  }
 81
 82  void find(T *&pointer) { pointer = this->data_;}
 83  void rebind(T *pointer) { this->data_ = pointer;}
 84
 85private:
 86  user_storage_type format_;
 87  T* data_;
 88};
 89
 90
 91
 92/// User_storage specialization for complex types.
 93///
 94/// Can store user-storage in array format, interleaved format, or
 95/// split format.
 96template <typename T>
 97class User_storage<complex<T> >
 98{
 99public:
100  User_storage()
101    : format_(no_user_format)
102  {
103    // Zero everything out so that find() returns NULL values.
104    this->u_.data_ = 0;
105    this->u_.split_.real_ = 0;
106    this->u_.split_.imag_ = 0;
107  }
108
109  User_storage(user_storage_type format, complex<T> *data)
110    : format_(format)
111  {
112    assert(format == array_format);
113    this->u_.data_ = data;
114  }
115
116  User_storage(user_storage_type format, T *real, T *imag)
117    : format_(format)
118  { 
119    assert(format == interleaved_format || format == split_format);
120    this->u_.split_.real_ = real;
121    this->u_.split_.imag_ = imag;
122  }
123
124  user_storage_type format() const { return this->format_;}
125
126  complex<T> get(index_type i)
127  {
128    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
129
130    if (this->format_ == array_format)
131      return this->u_.data_[i];
132    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
133      return complex<T>(this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+0],
134			this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+1]);
135    else // if (format_ == split_format)
136      return complex<T>(this->u_.split_.real_[i],
137			this->u_.split_.imag_[i]);
138  }
139
140  void put(index_type i, complex<T> val)
141  {
142    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
143
144    if (this->format_ == array_format)
145      this->u_.data_[i] = val;
146    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
147    {
148      this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+0] = val.real();
149      this->u_.split_.real_[2*i+1] = val.imag();
150    }
151    else // if (format_ == split_format)
152    {
153      this->u_.split_.real_[i] = val.real();
154      this->u_.split_.imag_[i] = val.imag();
155    }
156  }
157
158  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
159  /// a Storage class with array/interleaved format, or return NULL.
160  typename Storage<Cmplx_inter_fmt, complex<T> >::type
161  as_storage(Cmplx_inter_fmt) const
162  {
163    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
164
165    if (this->format_ == array_format)
166      return this->u_.data_;
167    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
168      return (complex<T>*)this->u_.split_.real_;
169    else // if (format_ == split_format)
170      return NULL;
171  }
172
173  /// Return the user storage in a format acceptable for initializing
174  /// a Storage class with split format, or return effective NULL.
175  typename Storage<Cmplx_split_fmt, complex<T> >::type
176  as_storage(Cmplx_split_fmt) const
177  {
178    assert(this->format_ != no_user_format);
179
180    if (this->format_ == array_format)
181      return std::pair<T*, T*>(0, 0);
182    else if (this->format_ == interleaved_format)
183      return std::pair<T*, T*>(0, 0);
184    else // if (format_ == split_format)
185      return std::pair<T*, T*>(this->u_.split_.real_, this->u_.split_.imag_);
186  }
187
188  void find(complex<T> *&pointer) { pointer = this->u_.data_;}
189  void find(T *&pointer) { pointer = this->u_.split_.real_;}
190  void find(T *&real_pointer, T *&imag_pointer)
191  {
192    real_pointer = this->u_.split_.real_;
193    imag_pointer = this->u_.split_.imag_;
194  }
195
196  void rebind(complex<T> *pointer)
197  {
198    this->u_.data_ = pointer;
199    this->format_  = array_format;
200  }
201
202  void rebind(T *pointer)
203  {
204    this->u_.split_.real_ = pointer; 
205    this->format_         = interleaved_format;
206  }
207
208  void rebind(T *real_pointer, T *imag_pointer)
209  {
210    this->u_.split_.real_ = real_pointer;
211    this->u_.split_.imag_ = imag_pointer;
212    this->format_         = split_format;
213  }
214
215private:
216  user_storage_type format_;
217  union 
218  {
219    complex<T> *data_;
220    struct 
221    {
222      T *real_;
223      T *imag_;
224    } split_;
225  } u_;
226};
227
228} // namespace vsip::impl
229} // namespace vsip
230
231#endif
